titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I worked again at the Glasgow Lecture. In the afternoon Ella and I motored to Durham where I attended a meeting of the Maintenance & Training of the Clergy Committee, and afterwards discussed Diocesan Business with my Suffragan. We returned to Auckland by way of Brancepeth where we called on M
Crawley, & got a setting of eggs.
Lionel and I motored to Witton Park, and there I confirmed 42 persons. They came from three parishes, viz.
About 120 persons reached the age of 14 last year. Of the 42 whom I confirmed a substantial proportion were adults. Of the 3 incumbents,
was a labourer's son, & has never had any formal education at all.

was at no university. They hardly illustrate the value of an Established Church which provides, for the uplifting of the people, 'a gentleman & a scholar' in every parish! The personal insignificance of the parochial clergy is a heavy drawback to religious work in this diocese. They count for nothing with the people.
